intro: Aulomyrcia poeppigiana, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while the flowers are clustered in inflorescences. Aulomyrcia poeppigiana is often found in moist, well-drained soils in humid environments.
